intro: Astragalus sogotensis, commonly known as the Sogdian milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes, which are typically visited by pollinators such as bees. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Astragalus sogotensis is often found in steppes and rocky slopes, where it plays a role in soil stabilization and ecological diversity.
